headline: 170 Million Users At Stake: Tim Stokely's Zoop Makes Last-Minute TikTok Bid, Promising Creators 'The Lion's Share' Of Ad Revenue
summary: Tim Stokely, the founder of subscription content platform OnlyFans, has submitted a last-minute bid to acquire TikTok's U.S. operations. Stokely's offer comes through Zoop, a social media platform he helped launch. It is in partnership with the HBAR Foundation, which oversees the treasury of the Hedera cryptocurrency network. The bid promises to radically change how creators earn on the platform by distributing 80% of ad revenue directly to content creators and users, according to a press releas

headline: President Trump's 145% China Tariffs Will Hurt Amazon. Here's Why I'm Still Buying the Stock.
summary: Few companies are as harmed by the escalating trade war between the U.S. and China as Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN).  While some may think that Amazon will be a casualty in this trade war, other facts dispute this claim.  As a result, I think using the weakness on the tariff fears to buy Amazon stock is the smart move, as there are far more factors to Amazon than just its e-commerce business.

headline: Amazon Is Better Prepared for the Trade War Than Investors Think
summary: Amazon’s  retail business is particularly affected by the escalating trade battle with China, which currently includes a 145% tariff on imports to the U.S. Around 25% of products Amazon directly sells originate in China, Morgan Stanley estimates.  The company’s large logistics footprint and relationships with global suppliers mean it can move inventory and production to countries not as hard hit by tariffs.  The company canceled some vendor orders from China after the tariffs went into effect, a prelude, potentially, to a geographic shift.

headline: Stock Market Sell-Off: 2 Brilliant AI Stocks to Buy Hand Over Fist Right Now, According to Wall Street
summary: Economic uncertainty created by President Trump's trade policies has caused the U.S. stock market to decline sharply in 2025.  The benchmark S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) is currently down 14%, while the technology-focused Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) is down 19%.  Among the 63 analysts that follow Nvidia, 90% have a buy rating on the stock.
